predicate.note: Frames file for 'finish' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison with 'end' for one of the rolesets and 'close' for the next.

roleset.name: cause to stop
roleset.note: ArgM might be TMP if a time period is finishing, might be EXT if some financial thing is the Arg1, might be LOC if it's a spatial thing finishing, perhaps MNR also

example.name: arg1 as pro-controlled S
example.text: Moreover, Suez had just finished winning an even larger battle last year for control of Societe Generale de Belgique.
example.arg: [Suez] [winning an even larger battle last year for control of Societe Generale de Belgique]

example.name: arg1 as NP
example.text: The Senate's public gallery was packed with Judge Hastings' supporters , who erupted into applause after he finished his argument.

roleset.name: terminate
roleset.note: in this corpus, primarily of stocks

role.descr: up, down, or unchanged, or degree of change

example.name: manner and extent
example.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which had jumped 41.60 points on Tuesday, drifted on either side of its previous close and finished with a gain of just 0.82 at 2645.90.
example.arg: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which had jumped 41.60 points on Tuesday,

roleset.name: apply a finish, as to wood

example.name: all args
example.text: John finished his new armoire in a lovely shade of chartreuse.

roleset.note: I wonder if this sense will ever appear.
